intro: Diospyros torresii, commonly known as the Philippine persimmon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible when fully ripe. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and ovate, with a smooth margin. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces a sticky, milky sap that is characteristic of the genus.
